sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
The strange discovery a tragi-comedy. Written by I.G. Gent. J. G. (John Gough), fl. 1640. Heliodorus, of Emesa.
[88] p.
Printed by E[dward] G[riffin] for William Leake, and are to be sold at his shop in Chancery-lane, joyning to the Roles, London : 1640.
I.G. = John Gough. Based on Heliodorus. Printer's name from STC. Signatures: [A]¹ B-M⁴ (-M4, =[A]1). A variant of the edition with "I. Gough" on the title page. Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
=======

[88] p.
Printed by E[dward] G[riffin] for William Leake, and are to be sold at his shop in Chancery-lane, joyning to the Roles, London : 1640.
I.G. = John Gough. Based on Heliodorus. Printer's name from STC. Signatures: [A]¹ B-M⁴ (-M4, =[A]1). A variant of the edition with "I. Gough" on the title page. Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
